hypothesis_content.title: Overnight Asian Session Gap Fade in Low Volatility Environments
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes with BTC 20-day historical volatility <45%, when price gaps >1.2% at Asian session open (00:00-02:00 UTC) against the previous US session close direction, fading the gap (trading in opposite direction) yields positive expectancy with >68% fill rate by London open (08:00 UTC).
hypothesis_content.rationale: In low-volatility neutral regimes, Asian session gaps are often caused by thin liquidity and overreaction to news/events. Market microstructure tends to revert these gaps as European liquidity enters. The volatility filter ensures we're not fading breakaway gaps during high-volatility regimes where continuation is more likely.
entry_conditions: Price gap >1.2% between 23:50 UTC (previous day) and 00:10 UTC (Asian open)
Entry at 00:15 UTC candle open, trading opposite gap direction

exit_conditions.take_profit: 80% gap fill OR previous session close price
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 0.8% beyond gap opening price (in gap direction)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 08:00 UTC (London open) if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Fewer than 60% of gaps fill by London open OR average loss per trade >0.4% when tested across 100+ instances. Strategy fails during high volatility (>60%) periods.
